images.copyright: Rainbow Pool and the field of stars in the World War II Memorial with the Lincoln Memorial in the background, Washington, DC (© Sean Pavone/Getty Images)
images.title: A day of remembrance
images.caption: Memorial Day
images.desc: Today, on Memorial Day, many will no doubt stand before this fountain on the National Mall in Washington, DC. Dedicated 18 years ago as our national World War II Memorial, it's become one of the most popular sites in the nation's capital, and now receives more than 4 million visitors each year. To the west, toward the setting sun, is the Reflecting Pool and the Lincoln Memorial. To the east, unseen here, is the Washington Monument.
